Description: Fragment of rim of East Greek pottery dish (or fruit stand?). Clay light reddish, slip ivory; paint sepia and purplish red, appearing orange-brown and red-brown on inside. Sloping floor, short flat rim; foot lost. Key pattern on top of rim, between narrow brown bands; brown stripes on edge of rim. Narrow sepia-brown and red bands alternating on both sides of bowl and on underside of rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes (1992 p207 no. N18): "Type unusual; the white slip resembles that on Chian vases. Tocra II no. 2056 pl.17 in coarser style, may be related in ware."
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 207 no. N18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.441)
